greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to the equation x^4+y^4 = n with x >= y > 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: For n = 2 there is one solution: 2 = 1^4 + 1^4, thus a(2) = 1.
For n = 17 there is one solution: 17 = 2^4 + 1^4, thus a(17) = 1.

For n = 635318657 we have two solutions: 635318657 = 158^4 + 59^4 = 134^4 + 133^4, thus a(635318657) = 2. Note that this is the first point where the sequence attains value greater than 1. See _Charles R Greathouse IV_'s Jan 12 2017 comment in A216280.
results.author: _V. Raman_, Sep 03 2012
ext: Definition edited to match the given data and the second part of offset (635318657) explicitly added by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 28 2017
